fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.description: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, MSH-17-country code is used to determine the default. Example:

fields.name: Price Type
fields.description: A coded value, data type ID. Refer to HL7 table 0205 - Price type for valid values.

fields.name: From Value
fields.description: Each is a NM data type; together they specify the range. The range can be defined as either time or quantity. For example, the range can indicate that the first 10 minutes of the procedure has one price. Another repetition of the data type can use the range to specify that the following 10 to 60 minutes of the procedure is charged at another price per; a final repetition can specify that the final 60 to N minutes of the procedure at a third price.

fields.name: To Value
fields.description: See <from value> above.

fields.name: Range Units
fields.description: Subcomponents of range units: <identifier (ID)> & <text (ST)> & <name of coding system (ST)> & <alternate identifier (ID)> & <alternate text (ST)> & <name of alternate coding system (ST)>

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Range Type
fields.description: Refers to HL7 table 0298 - CP range type for valid values.

fields.name: Grouper Version And Type
fields.description: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only. This field has moved to the new DRG segment; refer to the field definition 6.4.3.0. When used for backward compatibility, this field contains the grouper version and type.

fields.name: Diagnosis Priority
fields.description: This field contains the number that identifies the significance or priority of the diagnosis code. Refer to HL7 table 0359 - Diagnosis priority for valid values.

fields.name: Diagnosing Clinician
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the individual responsible for generating the diagnosis information. Multiple names and identifiers for the same person may be sent in this field, not multiple diagnosing clinicians. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components for this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Diagnosis Classification
fields.description: This field indicates if the patient information is for a diagnosis or a non-diagnosis code. Refer to user-defined table 0228 - Diagnosis classification for suggested values.

fields.name: Confidential Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates whether the diagnosis is confidential. Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Attestation Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the time stamp that indicates the date and time that the attestation was signed.

segments.description: The DRG segment contains diagnoses-related grouping information of various types. The DRG segment is used to send the DRG information, for example, for billing and medical records encoding.

fields.name: Diagnostic Related Group
fields.description: This field contains the DRG for the transaction. Interim DRG's could be determined for an encounter. For the identifier component, user-defined table 0055-DRG is used as the identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field . For the name of coding system component, send the grouper version and type.

fields.name: Text

When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: DRG Assigned Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the time stamp to indicate the date and time that the DRG was assigned.

fields.name: DRG Approval Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates if the DRG has been approved by a reviewing entity. Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: DRG Grouper Review Code
fields.description: User-defined table 0056 - DRG grouper review code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field . This code indicates that the grouper results have been reviewed and approved.

fields.name: Outlier Type
fields.description: Refer to user-defined table 0083 - Outlier type for suggested values. Refers to the type of outlier that has been paid.

fields.name: Outlier Days
fields.description: This field contains the number of days that have been approved as an outlier payment.

fields.name: Outlier Cost
fields.description: This field contains the amount of money that has been approved for an outlier payment.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: Subcomponents of price: <quantity> & <denomination>

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.description: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, MSH-17-country code is used to determine the default. Example:

fields.name: DRG Payor
fields.description: This field indicates the associated DRG Payor. Refer to user-defined table 0229 - DRG payor for suggested values.

fields.name: Outlier Reimbursement
fields.description: Where applicable, the outlier reimbursement amount indicates the part of the total reimbursement designated for reimbursement of outlier conditions (day or cost).

segments.description: The AL1 segment contains patient allergy information of various types. Most of this information will be derived from user-defined tables. Each AL1 segment describes a single patient allergy.

fields.name: Set ID - AL1
fields.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one, for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two, etc.

fields.name: Allergy Type
fields.description: This field indicates a general allergy category (drug, food, pollen, etc.). Refer to user-defined table 0127 - Allergy type for suggested values.

fields.name: Allergy Code/Mnemonic/Description
fields.description: This field uniquely identifies a particular allergy. This element may conform to some external, standard coding system (that must be identified), or it may conform to local, largely textual or mnemonic descriptions.

fields.name: Allergy Severity
fields.description: This field indicates the general severity of the allergy (severe, moderate, mild, etc.). Refer to user-defined table 0128 - Allergy severity for suggested values.

fields.name: Allergy Reaction
fields.description: This field contains a short, textual description of the specific allergy reaction (convulsions, sneeze, rash, etc.).

fields.name: Identification Date
fields.description: This field contains the date that the allergy was identified.

segments.description: The NTE segment is defined here for inclusion in messages defined in other chapters. It is a common format for sending notes and comments.

fields.name: Set ID - NTE
fields.description: This field may be used where multiple NTE segments are included in a message. Their numbering must be described in the application message definition.

fields.name: Source of Comment
fields.description: This field is used when source of comment must be identified. This table may be extended locally during implementation.

fields.name: Comment
fields.description: This field contains the comment contained in the segment.

fields.name: Comment Type
fields.description: This field contains a value to identify the type of comment text being sent in the specific comment record. Refer to user-defined table 0364-Comment type for suggested values.
